solution_line_template: The cost of a regularly-priced uniform is ${regular_shirt_cost} for the shirt + ${regular_pants_cost} for pants + ${regular_socks_cost} for socks = $<<{regular_shirt_cost}+{regular_pants_cost}+{regular_socks_cost}={regular_uniform_cost}>>{regular_uniform_cost}.

The cost of a discounted uniform is ${discounted_shirt_cost} for the shirt + ${discounted_pants_cost} for pants + ${discounted_socks_cost} for socks = $<<{discounted_shirt_cost}+{discounted_pants_cost}+{discounted_socks_cost}={discounted_uniform_cost}>>{discounted_uniform_cost}.

By purchasing the discounted uniform, each team member would save ${regular_uniform_cost} for full price - ${discounted_uniform_cost} for discounted= $<<{regular_uniform_cost}-{discounted_uniform_cost}={savings_per_member}>>{savings_per_member}.
So, for the team of {num_team_members}, they would save ${savings_per_member} * {num_team_members} = $<<{savings_per_member}*{num_team_members}={total_savings}>>{total_savings}
